item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18713)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @BLM5280 was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=BLM5280&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

item.title: CW: Mention of sexual assault IMG text: In late February, a...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

CW: Mention of sexual assault
IMG text: In late February, a woman came forward to BLM5280 alleging that Director Tay Anderson is the perpetrator of her sexual assault. At the request of the alleged survivor, we are publicly sharing this information in hopes of ensuring her and all of our safety and well-being. We trust that our supporters and community partners, as well as Dir. Anderson’s supporters and community partners, will be mindful of the struggle in outing oneself as... a survivor of sexual assault; particularly when bringing allegations forth against a person in a position of power and influence. As such, the alleged survivor has requested to remain anonymous at this time. Please respect her boundaries.
At present, the alleged survivor’s only requests of Dir. Anderson are that he issue a public apology and seek help from a licensed professional with relevant expertise. The alleged victim’s requests are in alignment with restorative justice—one of our guiding values as a chapter. Bear in mind that although these allegations have not gone through a formal legal process, BLM5280 is fiercely committed to protecting, uplifting, and believing Black women, decidedly as it relates to sexual violence. When we say protect Black women this must entail calling in those who have allegedly caused harm, including elected officials. Until Dir. Anderson has accounted for himself in these ways, he will not be welcome to share space with BLM5280 physically or on any of our platforms.
Black Lives Matter 5280
www.blacklivesmatter5280.com
blacklivesmatter5280@gmail.com

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: CW: Mention of sexual assault ...
item.content:encoded:
CW: Mention of sexual assault
IMG text: In late February, a woman came forward to BLM5280 alleging that Director Tay Anderson is the perpetrator of her sexual assault. At the request of the alleged survivor, we are publicly sharing this information in hopes of ensuring her and all of our safety and well-being. We trust that our supporters and community partners, as well as Dir. Anderson’s supporters and community partners, will be mindful of the struggle in outing oneself as a survivor of sexual assault; particularly when bringing allegations forth against a person in a position of power and influence. As such, the alleged survivor has requested to remain anonymous at this time. Please respect her boundaries.
At present, the alleged survivor’s only requests of Dir. Anderson are that he issue a public apology and seek help from a licensed professional with relevant expertise. The alleged victim’s requests are in alignment with restorative justice—one of our guiding values as a chapter. Bear in mind that although these allegations have not gone through a formal legal process, BLM5280 is fiercely committed to protecting, uplifting, and believing Black women, decidedly as it relates to sexual violence. When we say protect Black women this must entail calling in those who have allegedly caused harm, including elected officials. Until Dir. Anderson has accounted for himself in these ways, he will not be welcome to share space with BLM5280 physically or on any of our platforms.
Black Lives Matter 5280
www.blacklivesmatter5280.com
blacklivesmatter5280@gmail.com

item.title: CW: mention of sexual assault and sexual abuse ...
item.content:encoded:
CW: mention of sexual assault and sexual abuse

We’re launching our first BLM 5280 Sexual Assault Awareness Month Campaign! Details to come on April 1st.

Img text: 1 in 4 Black girls will be sexually abused before age 18. 1 in 5 Black women are survivors of rape. 40% of confirmed sex trafficking survivors in the U.S. are Black.

Sexual Assault Awareness Month
#BelieveBlackWomen #BLM5280SAAM

April 2021
Details Coming Soon

For collaboration and/or event sponsorship, e-mail blacklivesmatter5280@gmail.com

item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Denver City Council meetings always like to include our name without actually including us......
item.content:encoded:
Denver City Council meetings always like to include our name without actually including us...

Img text: Press Release: DPD Police Chief Pazen Misleads about BLM5280 Involvement.

During the Denver City Council Safety, Housing, Education, and Homelessness Committee meeting on March 24, 2021, DPD Chief Pazen provided a community update on the co-responder program and the Support Team Assistance Response (STAR) program. Chief Pazen inaccurately reported that BLM 5280 had representation on the group that aided in creating the STAR program. BLM 5280 nor any of its individual members sit on this advisory board. Chief Pazen nor his team consulted us on this presentation and did not even notify us of the presentation.

We support the need for non-law enforcement community responses to 9-1-1 and crisis calls, such as the STAR pilot program. We would not work with law enforcement-led co-responder models, which send police officers and mostly white social workers to calls. The current co-responder models lack trauma-informed care through sending law enforcement to crisis calls.

We encourage community engagement and involvement in conversations around public safety and policy changes regarding public safety. Oftentimes, Black people and communities (particularly Black women and Black LGBTQIA folx) are not invited to these conversations. As a chapter, we are also not invited to the table in these conversations, or our input is disregarded.

If you want to know about the work that BLM 5280 is doing in the community, please consult our social media pages or our newly revamped website: www.blacklivesmatter5280.com.
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: "The tension is this: Black nerds unsettle the myth of a...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

"The tension is this: Black nerds unsettle the myth of a monolithic Blackness. In an American imagination that has historically stereotyped Black people as alternately ignorant and emotional or sexualized and cool, the nerd — smart and cerebral, unsexy and decidedly uncool — creates cognitive dissonance. Not only do Black nerds confound racist stereotypes, they also pierce the protective orthodoxy of Blackness passed down in the United States across generations.

https://www.nytimes.com/…/t-magazi…/black-nerds-culture.html

By pushing back against centuries-old stereotypes, a historically overlooked community is claiming space it was long denied.

nytimes.com

The Black Nerds Redefining the Culture

By pushing back against centuries-old stereotypes, a historically overlooked community is claiming space it was long denied.By pushing back against centuries-old stereotypes, a historically overlooked community is claiming space it was long denied.
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: "Medical racism persists beyond historical fact to become...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

"Medical racism persists beyond historical fact to become current tradition, and inequalities can only be magnified by the circumstance of an emergency. How many more opportunities for widened healthcare disparity has #Covid19 given us?"
https://www.wearyourvoicemag.com/what-a-black-woman-medica…/

Medical racism persists beyond historical fact to become current tradition, and inequalities can only be magnified by the circumstance of an emergency.

wearyourvoicemag.com

What A Black Woman Medical Provider Sees Watching The COVID-19 Pandemic Unfold

Medical racism persists beyond historical fact to become current tradition, and inequalities can only be magnified by the circumstance of an emergency.Medical racism persists beyond historical fact to become current tradition, and inequalities can only be magnified by the circumstance of an emergency.

item.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Mental Health ColoradoToday, Colorado mourns the loss of ten lives. Our hearts break for the families who lost loved...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280Mental Health Colorado

Today, Colorado mourns the loss of ten lives. Our hearts break for the families who lost loved ones in the Boulder shooting.

Please take advantage of the follo...wing resources:
- Managing your distress in the aftermath of a shooting: www.apa.org/topics/mass-shooting
- Coping with Mass Shootings: www.realwarriors.net/grief-loss/cope-after-mass-shootings
- Mass Violence Resources: www.nctsn.org/…/trauma…/terrorism-and-violence/mass-violence

item.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Therapy Aid Coalition is in Boulder, Colorado.Today’s shooting incident in Boulder is still unfolding, with many...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280Therapy Aid Coalition is in Boulder, Colorado.

Today’s shooting incident in Boulder is still unfolding, with many details unknown. Therapy Aid is mobilizing our colorado therapists to help serve those impac...ted. If you are already one of our therapists, licensed in CO, please log in if you’re willing to serve this incident. If you’re not a therapy aid therapist but you’re licensed in CO with trauma and crisis response skills, please register to assist. Please share! Thank you!

item.content:encoded:

“A rally for the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American Community and our allies to mourn those lost to Anti-Asian hate, celebrate our strength and diversity, and band together to move forward in doing anti-racist work.

Join us for music, poetry, words of wisdom, healing, and more.

Make sure to bring water, snacks, and layers in case it gets cold!

...

Want to VOLUNTEER? Sign up here: https://forms.gle/koQPMGHDnpaRpPuP6”

item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Join Black Parents of Denver, Get Busy Living Studios,...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Join Black Parents of Denver, Get Busy Living Studios, TAndIVoice, Taylors Voice & Compound of compassion as we bring awareness to the ongoing violence within Denver's communities and the Police brutality that comes along with our struggle. We Will have What's Happening Catering On site to feed our houseless friends in Denver. Our goal is to feed 300 people on this day hot fresh food. You can purchase a ticket from anywhere in the world to feed a person, 15 dollars gets them ...a full plate and a drink. You can also watch our live performances from Artists Like Texas Rapper C-Lane and Denver's own Nic Wit It, Trrii the Truth and Chane Clouds, along with many poets, speakers and special guest Jessie Cedillos mother, Lynette Fox speaking. Vendors Are welcome to come set up pls call 7202699902 all fees collected for vendor booth will go to feeding our houseless friends. Participants are encouraged to bring outreach resources to event such as clothes, canned goods or toiletries to pass out to our houseless friends. If any community organization would like to come out and participate pls call 7202699902

See More

HAPPENING NOW

Stop The Violence Denver 2021 Buy a homeless person a plate!!!

Online EventCauses · 540 people

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...

coloradogives.org

Black Lives Matter 5280

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism.
